robot_description2: When Dr. Light was conceptualizing robot ideas, he had decided that an alternative take on an electricity-based robot would be beneficial, hence Plug Man's creation. He was designed to test the quality control in a television factory, although he's more notably known for being an unwilling facet in Dr. Wily's expiration date plot. Plug Man's main weapon is the Plug Ball, a small, round electric-based ball that can scurry on surfaces that aren't even conductive! Yet, despite his electrical capabilities, Plug Man simply doesn't have the heart of a fighter compared to his electrical counterpart, Elec Man; he's certainly much more into the casual aspects of life in Mega City. He's obsessed with electronic stores, and an connoisseur of various shonen and slice-of-life animes. He's also not afraid about talking with his friends about geeky subjects, and he also seems to be good friends with Bright Man. Despite being a bit odd, he's an incredibly nice person to know and chat with. And, if you likely ask him nicely enough, he'd probably be willing to power your TV for you!
robot_quotes_start: Now that I'm plugged up, I'm ready for action!
robot_quotes_taunt: So, uh, {target_robot}... What's your favorite anime?
robot_quotes_victory: Game over! A winner is me, hehe!
robot_quotes_defeat: No! I can't lose here.. They're having a tech sale at Akihabara today!
